bargueno-relicario.title: Bargueño Reliquary
bargueno-relicario.author: Anonymous
bargueno-relicario.typology: Polychrome wood desk-reliquary with coral applications
bargueno-relicario.desc: Mannerist bargueño furniture with glass drawers containing relics, conceived as a devotional desk with rich ornamental polychromy.

casulla-santa-ana.title: Chasuble of Saint Anne
casulla-santa-ana.author: Nuns of the Royal Monastery of Saint Joachim and Saint Anne
casulla-santa-ana.desc: Richly embroidered silk chasuble, with scenes and allegories of the theological and cardinal virtues, crafted by nuns with meticulous technique. The embroidery depicts the virtues in painted silk, bordered with gold trimmings.

jesus-en-la-cruz.title: Jesus on the Cross
jesus-en-la-cruz.desc: Small-scale figure of Christ on the Cross, crafted in papier-mâché, depicted in the classical Calvary pose with loincloth and crown of thorns.

cristo-yacente.title: Recumbent Christ
cristo-yacente.author: Gregorio Fernández
cristo-yacente.desc: Christ after the Descent from the Cross, lying upon the shroud with visible wounds of the Passion, serene and calm before burial. A Baroque work noted for its polychromy and anatomical realism.

ecce-homo.title: Ecce Homo
ecce-homo.author: Francisco Alonso de los Ríos
ecce-homo.desc: Figure of Christ after the flagellation, half-naked and bound, showing his wounded body as he is presented to the people.

cristo-atado-a-la-columna.title: Jesus Bound to the Column
cristo-atado-a-la-columna.author: Anonymous
cristo-atado-a-la-columna.desc: Christ half-naked beside the column, with scourge marks visible on his body, depicted at the moment of being presented bound for punishment.

novisimos.title: The Last Things
novisimos.author: Giovanni Bernardino Azzolino
novisimos.desc: Four allegorical scenes representing the soul’s final destinies, from serene contemplation to its passage through purifying states. Late Mannerism and early Baroque, illustrating the soul’s journey after death.

reliquia-dorada.title: Golden Reliquary
reliquia-dorada.desc: Altar reliquary made of gilded metal and gems, with a small carved crystal showing the figure of Christ, used to project his image during liturgical ceremonies.

san-bernardo-con-la-virgen.title: Saint Bernard with the Virgin
san-bernardo-con-la-virgen.author: Luis Salvador Carmona
san-bernardo-con-la-virgen.desc: Saint Bernard in ecstasy contemplates the apparition of the Virgin and Child descending among clouds and cherubs, in a mystical dialogue.

san-jose-con-el-nino.title: Saint Joseph with the Child
san-jose-con-el-nino.author: Attributed to Luisa Ignacia Roldán Villavicencio 'La Roldana'
san-jose-con-el-nino.typology: Polychrome wood, Andalusian school with exquisite finish
san-jose-con-el-nino.desc: Saint Joseph tenderly holds the Child in his arms, in a frontal posture, upon a base with cherubs, highlighting sacred fatherhood.

tapiz.title: Oriental Style (inspired by the Ushak region)
tapiz.desc: Large-format carpet of oriental style with floral ornamentation, made in Cuenca. Woven wool with central medallion and floral design inspired by Ushak models, using Turkish knot technique.

virgen-asuncion.title: Virgin of the Assumption
virgen-asuncion.author: Anonymous
virgen-asuncion.desc: The Virgin rises to heaven surrounded by clouds and angelic children, arms open and gaze lifted, representing her glorious Assumption.

virgen-de-mena.title: Our Lady of Sorrows
virgen-de-mena.author: Pedro de Mena
virgen-de-mena.desc: Masterful sculpture of the Virgin with hands clasped and sorrowful face, expressing deep inner grief before the Passion of her Son.

virgen-romanica.title: Romanesque Virgin
virgen-romanica.author: Anonymous
virgen-romanica.desc: Virgin seated frontally and majestically, crowned and holding the Child on her lap, following the Romanesque iconographic scheme.

goya-uno.title: Goya One
goya-uno.author: Francisco de Goya
goya-uno.desc: A pictorial work by Francisco de Goya.

cuadro-la-elevacion-de-la-cruz.title: Elevation of the Cross
cuadro-la-elevacion-de-la-cruz.author: Anonymous
cuadro-la-elevacion-de-la-cruz.desc: A pictorial representation of the Elevation of the Cross.
